description: From Latin arduus (“lofty, high, steep, hard to reach, difficult, laborious”), akin to Irish ard (“high”).

adjectives.description: arduous (comparative more arduous, superlative most arduous)

entries.meaning: Needing or using up much energy; testing powers of endurance.
examples: The movement towards a peaceful settlement has been a long and arduous political struggle.
Where flames the arduous Spirit of Isidore.
Mike looked up from the arduous mountain trail. They'd been climbing for five hours and he was beginning to feel irritable.
